sen.j: 中村 勘三郎（なかむら かんざぶろう）は、歌舞伎役者の名跡。
sen.e: Kanzaburo NAKAMURA was a professional name of a kabuki actor.
Kanzaburo NAKAMURA is a Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) actor's professional name.
Kanzaburo NAKAMURA is a Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) actor's professional name.

sen.j: 屋号は、初代以降が柏屋、十四代目以降が舞鶴屋、十七代目以降が中村屋 (歌舞伎)。
sen.e: The stage family name of Kanzaburo NAKAMURA the first to the thirteenth was Kashiwaya, that of Kanzaburo NAKAMURA the fourteenth to the sixteenth was Maizuruya, and that of Kanzaburo NAKAMURA the seventeenth and later was Nakamuraya (kabuki).
The stage family name of from the first to the 13th was Kashiwaya, from the 14th to the 16th was Maizuruya, and the 17th and later was Nakamuraya (kabuki).
The stage family name of from the first to the 13th was Kashiwaya, from the 14th to the 16th was Maizuruya, and the 17th and later was Nakamuraya (kabuki).

sen.j: 定紋は、初め丸に舞鶴（まるに まいづる）だったが、のち角切銀杏（すみきり いちょう）に代わった（→ 詳細は「鶴字法度」を参照）。
sen.e: The jomon was a crane in a circle at first, but was later changed to ginkgo leaves in an octagon (For details, refer to 'Tsuruhime_(Tokugawa family) The prohibition law against the use of a Chinese character "crane"'.).

The Jomon (family crest) is Maru ni Maizuru (a crane in a circle) at first, but was later changed to Sumikiri Icho (ginkgo leaves in an octagon) (For details, refer to 'Kaku-ji Hatto' [The prohibition law against the use of a Chinese character "crane"]).
sen.cmt: 原文には 「鶴姫_(徳川家)鶴字法度」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「鶴字法度」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: The Jomon (family crest) is Maru ni Maizuru (a crane in a circle) at first, but was later changed to Sumikiri Icho (ginkgo leaves in an octagon) (For details, refer to 'Kaku-ji Hatto' [The prohibition law against the use of a Chinese character "crane"]).

sen.j: 当初「中村勘三郎」は江戸三座の一つ・中村座の座元（座を主宰し芝居小屋を経営する者）の名跡だったが、後代になると座元が役者に転じたり、逆に役者が座元を兼ねたりすることが多くなる。
sen.e: Kanzaburo NAKAMURA' was initially a professional name of Zamoto (leader and manager of a theatrical company) of Nakamura-za Theater, which was one of Edo's three licensed kabuki theaters, but in later ages, Zamoto often became actors, or actors doubled as Zamoto.

Kanzaburo NAKAMURA' was initially a professional name of Zamoto (leader and manager of a theatrical company) of Nakamura-za Theater, which was one of Edo's three licensed kabuki theaters, but in later ages, Zamoto often became actors, or actors additionally became Zamoto.

Kanzaburo NAKAMURA' was initially a professional name of Zamoto (leader and manager of a theatrical company) of Nakamura-za Theater, which was one of Edo's three licensed kabuki theaters, but in later ages, Zamoto often became actors, or actors additionally became Zamoto.

sen.j: そして明治になると劇場が企業化し、経営権が座元の手から離れた結果、「中村勘三郎」は単に役者の名跡のひとつとなった。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, theaters were corporatized, Zamoto lost the management right, and 'Kanzaburo NAKAMURA' became simply one of professional names of actors.
In the Meiji period, as the result that theaters were corporatized and Zamoto lost the management right, 'Kanzaburo NAKAMURA' became simply one of professional names of actors.
In the Meiji period, as the result that theaters were corporatized and Zamoto lost the management right, 'Kanzaburo NAKAMURA' became simply one of professional names of actors.

sen.j: 後に初代中村傳九郎を名乗る。
sen.e: He later called himself Denkuro NAKAMURA.
He later called himself the first Denkuro NAKAMURA.
sen.cmt: 訳もれ。「初代」を補足しました。
sen.e: He later called himself the first Denkuro NAKAMURA.

sen.e: - Adopted son-in-law of Kanzaburo NAKAMURA the eighth

The husband of the eighth's daughter.
His haimyo was Jakudo.
The haimyo (also known as haimei, a kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately) was Jakudo.
The haimyo (also known as haimei, a kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately) was Jakudo.

His haimyo was Kanshi (観子 or 冠子).
sen.cmt: 観子と冠子は日本語のままとしました。
sen.e: The haimyo was Kanshi (観子 or 冠子 in Chinese characters).
The haimyo was Kanshi (観子 or 冠子 in Chinese characters).

sen.e: - Second son of Kanzaburo NAKAMURA the eleventh

sen.j: 四代目中村明石、五代目中村傳九郎、晩年は隠居名の三代目中村勘九郎を名乗る。
sen.e: He called himself Akashi NAKAMURA the fourth, Denkuro NAKAMURA the fifth and in his last years, Kanzaburo NAKAMURA the third as a name after retirement.
He called himself the fourth Akashi NAKAMURA, the fifth Denkuro NAKAMURA and in his last years, the third Kanzaburo NAKAMURA as name for retirement.
He called himself the fourth Akashi NAKAMURA, the fifth Denkuro NAKAMURA and in his last years, the third Kanzaburo NAKAMURA as name for retirement.

sen.e: - Child of Kanzaburo NAKAMURA the twelfth

sen.j: - 十二代目の娘婿中村仲蔵 (3代目)をあてる。
sen.e: - The adopted son-in-law of Kanzaburo NAKAMURA the twelfth, Nakazo NAKAMURA the third, succeeded to the professional name.
The husband of the 12th's daughter, Nakazo NAKAMURA (the third), succeeded to the professional name.
The husband of the 12th's daughter, Nakazo NAKAMURA (the third), succeeded to the professional name.

sen.j: 俳名は雀枝、秀雀、舞鶴、秀鶴。
sen.e: His haimyo was Jakushi, Shujaku, Maizuru, and Shukaku.
His haimyo was Jakushi, Shujaku, Maizuru, and Shukaku.

sen.j: - 十三代目の子中村明石 (5代目)をあてる。
sen.e: - The son of Kanzaburo NAKAMURA the thirteenth, Akashi NAKAMURA the fifth, succeeded to the professional name.
The son of the 13th, Akashi NAKAMURA (the fifth), succeeded to the professional name.

sen.j: - 五代目中村明石の娘・中村勝子をあてる。
